During the last weeks I did some work including root cutting, potting and styling on a couple of my pre-bonsai trees.  My collection consists of a stock of approximately 100 trees ranging from European oak ([*Quercus robur*](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quercus_robur)), small-leaved lime ([*Tilia cordata*](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tilia_cordata)), pin oak ([*Quercus palustris*](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quercus_palustris)), horse-chestnut ([*Aesculus hippocastanum*](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aesculus_hippocastanum)),  European beech ([*Fagus sylvatica*](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fagus_sylvatica)), [*Ginkgo biloba*](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ginkgo_biloba), Common hazel (*Corylus avellana*), Creeping pine ([*Pinus mugo*](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pinus_mugo)), Scots pine ([*Pinus sylvestris*](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scots_pine)), English Yew ([*Taxus Baccata*](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taxus_baccata)), ... . Most of them are currently planted in the field.
